VERIFIED.meaning: GP entry confirmed by independent evidence

CONTRADICTED.meaning: GP entry conflicts with independent evidence

phases.title: Pre-Existing Conditions & Early Dismissal Pattern
phases.description: Objective medical history documenting EDS, TOS-positive Doppler, and chronic pain predating the care failures.

truthSpine.finding: COMPLETE FLOW CESSATION in distal subclavian during Adson's/EAST manoeuvres. 'Positive result.'
Chronic pain documented across multiple specialist letters
T/Z scores -2.3 to -2.6 (osteopenic range) - bone fragility documented

phases.keyMessage: 2019 duplex ultrasound objectively demonstrated vascular TOS. Any subsequent GP entries treating TOS as 'speculative' or 'functional' are contradicted by this high-tier evidence.

phases.title: Psychiatric Framing Begins
phases.description: The pattern of dismissing physical symptoms as psychological begins, despite objective evidence of pathology.

truthSpine.finding: 'issues with GP, as they did not believe his pain and accused him for attention seeking'
Referral REJECTED - 'Advised to refer to psychiatrist'
Jason Parry documented paraspinal muscle spasm, 'struggling to sleep as a result of back pain'
Patient self-stopped 600mg pregabalin. Pharmacist documented 'unwise to suddenly stop', advised TAPER to 300mg.
Rejected WITHOUT examination. Based on WRONG spinal area (lumbar not thoracic). FABRICATED 'neurologist clearance'.
7-point documentation failure. NO patient consultation, NO taper, ignored pharmacist warning from 10 days prior.
'Advised to stop pregabalin by GW and would like to continue.' Third-party corroboration of Williams decision.
Practice Manager refused buprenorphine patch replacement. ~4 DAYS before seizure.

gpEntries.content: MH1 Referral: explicitly links 'somatisation' to brother's death
'on same path as his brother who committed suicide after chronic pain'

phases.keyMessage: COMPLETE CAUSATION CHAIN Oct-Dec 2021: Pharmacist warned (08 Oct) → Bhaskar rejected with fabricated clearance (14 Oct) → Williams stopped 600mg with sparse documentation (18 Oct) → Clive refused patch (~19 Dec) → SEIZURE (23 Dec). 8 Gemini-verified findings.

phases.title: The Index Event - First Seizure
phases.description: First tonic-clonic seizure causing T5-T8 vertebral fractures. A&E and GP dismissed as 'soft tissue injury' without spinal imaging.

truthSpine.finding: Tonic-clonic seizure witnessed by family. 5-minute ambulance response (Category 1/2 life-threatening).
HR 133bpm (tachycardia), Entonox for back pain, 'extremely combative and confused', 'held to ground by father'
CT Head NAD. NO thoracic spine imaging. Discharged as 'soft tissue injury'.

gpEntries.content: 'Went to CXH A&E yesterday as had ?seizure - severe back pain'
111 prescribed 2 weeks morphine - GP removes second week claiming 'soft tissue injury'
'imaging has all been normal' - only CT head done, NOT spinal imaging

phases.keyMessage: Ambulance documented life-threatening triaging (5-min response), severe back pain requiring Entonox, combative post-ictal state. These objective markers were subsequently ignored.
breaches: No thoracic spine imaging despite NICE NG59 red flags
Dismissed as 'soft tissue' - fractures confirmed 10 months later
No neurology referral until SECOND seizure

phases.title: The Diagnostic Void
phases.description: The period during which T5-T8 vertebral fractures remained undiagnosed while patient repeatedly presented with thoracic pain.

truthSpine.finding: Epilepsy formally diagnosed. Right rib fracture 'aggravated further'.
Mr Hassany: 'MRI findings does not explain his severe back pain' - but discharged because LUMBAR MRI normal. WRONG AREA IMAGED.
T5-T8 VERTEBRAL FRACTURES confirmed. 'Development of mild depression... superior endplate of T5 to T8.'
truthSpine.source: MRI Report - Dr A. Kenji Yamamoto

gpEntries.content: Pain medication adjustments only - no thoracic imaging ordered
Psychiatric referral suggested while objective spinal pathology present

phases.keyMessage: 10-MONTH DIAGNOSTIC DELAY. Patient complained of exact thoracic pain location where fractures later confirmed. Neurospine discharged patient after imaging WRONG spinal region (lumbar not thoracic).

phases.title: The Covert Psychiatric Diagnosis
phases.description: Somatoform Pain Disorder applied during a telephone call about medication - AFTER MRI had already proven physical fractures.

truthSpine.finding: 'Pain remains a major concern' - documented severe physical symptoms 2 DAYS before somatoform applied
Major surgery planned - validates organic pathology

gpEntries.content: Somatoform Pain Disorder (E278) applied during telephone call about opioid switching. Patient never informed.
Morphine prescription coded 'Indication: Somatoform pain disorder' - legitimate pain medication for proven fractures being coded as psychiatric

phases.keyMessage: Psychiatric diagnosis applied (1) without psychiatric assessment, (2) without patient knowledge, (3) AFTER MRI proved T5-T8 fractures. Used wrong ICD-10 code (E278 vs F45.4).

phases.title: Further GP Misconduct
phases.description: Addiction allegations without testing; brother's suicide weaponised to dismiss physical symptoms.

truthSpine.finding: Mean HR 99bpm, sinus tachycardia documented - OBJECTIVE baseline 2 years before Morgan accused of stimulant use

gpEntries.content: 'the main issue here is opaite [sic] addiction' - NO toxicology testing performed
'Pulse 100 - I'm not sure about this' re stimulant denial - ignored 2 years of documented cardiac investigation
'doing same behaviour as brother trying to get pain medication and he committed suicide'

phases.keyMessage: 'Addiction' label applied without toxicology testing. Tachycardia (pulse 100) attributed to stimulants when 2-year documented cardiac history showed it was baseline. Brother's death weaponised to dismiss symptoms.
breaches: Addiction diagnosis without formal assessment or toxicology

phases.title: Vindication
phases.description: Independent specialists refute the psychiatric framing. Multiple vindication statements documented.

truthSpine.finding: 'Has never been reviewed by the FND team' - FND label applied without formal assessment
'no psychiatric/psychological basis for patient's pain' - explicitly rejected somatoform
Psychiatric assessment found NO PTSD, depression, psychosis, personality disorder, OR somatisation disorder
'medical explanations have been found for symptoms that he has been experiencing for a long time'
Formal diagnosis: 'Epilepsy with generalised seizures' - NOT functional/dissociative

gpEntries.content: Somatoform diagnosis marked INACTIVE - 'there were clear causes for his pain'

phases.keyMessage: Internal NHS vindication from subsequent GP. Multiple independent specialists confirmed organic pathology and rejected psychiatric framing.

phases.title: Continuing Objective Pathology
phases.description: Further imaging continues to confirm objective vascular and structural pathology, establishing 6-year timeline of documented disease.

truthSpine.finding: Dynamic compression of left subclavian artery + vein with arms abducted; focal stenosis
'A thoracic outlet syndrome affecting left subclavian artery cannot be excluded'
Bilateral subclavian veins 'compressed with no flow' at 90° abduction. Both artery and vein occluded in Surrender position.

phases.keyMessage: SIX-YEAR TIMELINE of documented vascular TOS: 2019 Duplex → 2024 MR → 2025 Doppler. All positive. Rebuts any 'functional/non-organic' narrative.

keyFindings: Formal diagnoses: Epilepsy, T5-T8 fractures, EDS (all ORGANIC)
Tremor listed as 'unknown aetiology' - NOT labelled functional
Patient states would prefer amputation - severity documented
Care transferred between hospitals to consolidate fragmented records
vascularVindication.significance: Independent non-neurology specialist vindicates organic pathology. Critical quantum evidence.

causationChain.title: Sleep Deprivation → Seizure → Fracture Chain

steps.event: Patient self-stops 600mg pregabalin due to side effects
Somatoform diagnosis applied AFTER fractures proven (F040)

causationChain.butForTest: But for the failures to treat pain adequately (leading to sleep deprivation) and image the spine (leading to delayed diagnosis), the patient would not have suffered the seizure, sustained the fractures, gone 10 months with untreated spinal fractures, or had psychiatric label contaminate his care for 2.5 years.

limitationAnalysis.reason: When patient discovered Somatoform diagnosis was formally on record
limitationAnalysis.section32: s.32(1)(b) deliberate concealment available - patient was never told of psychiatric diagnosis

breachRegister.nature: Failed to image thoracic spine despite red flags
Failed to order spinal imaging post-seizure
